data.title: Great food, Okay service
data.text:
This was a first time visit to this Nordstrom restaurant. We got there at 11am before the lunch rush. 

Our waiter was very nice, but unprepared and kind of dingy. He didn't know what the soup of the day was, didn't check on us to see if everything was okay or if we needed anything. We had to flag the hostess to get some help. But he made sure our food was cooked as requested. 

Our salads were fresh and the dressings were very good. My friend ordered cilantro lime salad (similar to the Cilantro Lime Chicken Tacos) without salt and she said it was perfect. (The chicken on that salad is usually pretty salty.) The Cilantro Lime Chicken Tacos are equally as good as those at Nordstrom's Blue Stove restaurants. DELICIOUS!!! 

We shared for dessert the Lemon Ricotta Shortcake (which is to die for!) and the Chocolate Paradise Cake. The slice of chocolate cake is HUGE & I took half of it home! The Lemon Ricotta Shortcake has fresh raspberries, blueberries & blackberries with fresh whipped cream & lemon curd sitting in the middle of a soft shortbread. 

The chocolate cake was so very moist, flavorful and little bits of toffee. It's not super rich or overly chocolately. 

It was a nice place to meet a friend and visit for a while. I'd definitely eat there again!

OH! Nordstrom will validate your parking lot ticket for 3 hours!!!!!

data.title: Fantastic! Six stars!!
data.text:
Super delicious! Truly one of the best burgers I've ever had. Many places claiming the best burger around douse their burgers with so much liquidy crap on them. This meat, ground daily in house, is excellent, flavor and with no need to over-sauce! They put on just the right amount of aioli. 

The calamari appetizer is also one of the best I've ever had. It was fried just perfectly and with great flavor!

Drinks are also fantastic. Service is top-of-the-line and the simple mod vibe is just perfect!!

data.title: Wonderful atmosphere and food
data.text: I only get the Salade Nicoise because it is so excellent.  It is made with grilled salmon instead of the usual tuna and the salmon is always cooked perfectly.  Nice bar, good wines, great coffee.  A good place to relax and enjoy good food and drink

data.title: Sunset view and dessert
data.text:
First time here in the evening... the night sky was particularly remarkable, courtesy of pollutants from the fires in Santa Clarita.  Sad beauty.  
Desserts are fabulous - we were unable to decide which of the two was better.  A wonderful dilemma!

data.title: Sandwiches and Salads
data.text: If you are in the Americana and want a quiet spot for good food, Bar Verde should be your first choice.  Most of the restaurants in the Americana are always crowded and the waits can be long.  Bar Verde is tucked away above it all and you can always get a table and the food is always fresh and delicious.  This is our go to spot before a movie.

data.title: Great!
data.text: The kids menu is quite affordable and delicious.  I enjoy their menu and how it changes seasonally.  My friend really liked the poke and their cocktails.   We enjoy eating al fresco with a view to the Americana.

data.title: Pizza and Salad
data.text:
I'm a fan of Nordstrom and when I shop, I love dining in their cafe. A few weeks ago, my husband and I tried the cafe at the Glendale location for the first time.

This is a newer Nordstrom and the cafe was more upscale and trendy than my normal go-to Nordstrom location. I was surprised ( pleasantly) at the difference. At my other Nordstrom, you order at a counter and your food is brought to your table via a table number. The Glendale location is full service.

We had a simple order- pizza, salad and a glass of champagne. The food was great and the service was attentive. It would have been nice to sit on the patio, but there was a large, noisy family occupying most of the tables, so we sat inside and we were the only customers inside. It was relaxing.

A very enjoyable experience. We will return.

Like my review? Check out my blog!

data.title: Excellent Food, Nice Vibe!
data.text:
We had a fantastic meal with an amazing view! 
The vibe of Bar Verde is quite modern and pleasing to say the least. 

We ended out sitting outside and had a great view of the Americana fountains. That definitely adds a nice touch. Tables and seating are comfy and the food is excellent! Same with the drinks. 

We started off with a calamari appetizer and a wings appetizer that was a special for the day. Both great! The cocktails were very well-made and priced well for being in the Americana also.

Entrees were really good as well. The flatbread pizzas were great- excellent high quality ingredients and the steak sandwich was really good as well as the fries accompanying it. I would say that the onion relish was a bit too sweet for the sandwich and needed to be a bit more savory. 

I am still giving Bar Verde a 5/5 even though our service was very subpar. I am keeping it at 5 because, while our waitress was not good, she was not mean, and the service at the tables around us being provided by other servers was just fine. I am sure next time, it will be better. 

Finally- the chocolate cake with caramel- this was fantastic! My goodness. This would be a great place even for cocktails and a dessert! I am looking forward to returning and bringing more friends!

data.title: Lunch al fresco
data.text: This is a delightful place for lunch on a weekday - it was wonderful to sit outdoors under the shade of their umbrellas.  Almost felt like a getaway from our real life!  Great selection of drinks as well as options for light or more substantial lunch. A great way to recover or take a break from serious shopping.  Definitely will be back.

data.title: Very nice terrace
data.text: Great place to have an outdoor dinner. The temperature was great, the service was excellent and the food was very good. Although its a bar/restaurant the food and service is very good.

data.title: Good hidden lunch spot at the Americana
data.text: The Americana at Brand has a lot of ground floor lunch options that are often mobbed at peak times. We ended up here after turning down a two hour wait at the new dumpling house around the corner. We were seated right away by the hostess, outdoors on the patio. My husband and daughter are sensitive to direct sunlight so we opted for a table in the shade (closer to the door leading back inside) and there was a heatlamp directed at my back. As time passed the sun shifted towards our table which helped warm me up. Our drinks took a long time to arrive and we noticed that other people who came in after us had drinks and apps before us. We did order from the bar however so that could have been a factor. I had the lavender blueberry martini which was very good and not too sweet. My husband had a beer that our server described as a cross between a Hefeweizen and an IPA (he liked it). Our 5-year old daughter was given crayons and a coloring/activity sheet to keep her entertained. The children's menu is printed separately on a small piece of cardstock. We ordered the panko-crusted chicken fingers for her, they were hot, crispy and tasty. They were brought out with our appetizer (as requested) and included french fries and sliced fruit. She ate the melon but left all the pineapple. There was quite a bit of pineapple which I thought was a strange choice for the children's menu since I don't know a lot of young kids that eat it. We had the chopped chicken tacos (4) as an appetizer and they were the best thing we ate that day. The taco shells were crispy and the filling was very flavorful. I would order it as my main dish next time. My husband and I shared the crispy kale salad (meh) and the grilled chicken aioli sandwich to share. These were just OK; good but I would try something else next time. The sandwich also came with fries. Their fries are skinny and you definitely need to eat with ketchup or add salt. Our particular server was nice but seemed to be working inside as well so she was slow to check on us. There were two other patio servers who had a much better hustle with their tables. I would definitely go back to try more menu items and will keep this place in mind for my next visit to the Americana.

data.title: View
data.text:
Enjoyed our lunch on the Patio high above the Americana. Our lunch was very good the chicken sandwiches were a good valve for the price. They definitely were not your run of the mill chicken sandwiches that are served in most restaurants. 
Didn't know if the restaurant was going to be as good as the restaurant at the Nordstrom's   in the galleria but we were not disappointed. It was a cool day so the heater was welcomed so we could still eat outside on the patio. We had great service with a very attentive server.

data.title: Great place for coffee
data.text: I recommend this coffee shop to spend good time with friends or family. It has nice sitting outdoor area and their coffee is good. I suggest to have more options for coffee and pastries.

data.title: なかなか雰囲気が良かったです
data.text:
カフェのチェーン店です。
スターバックスみたいにアチコチに出店しているわけではないので、有名とはいいがたいかも知れません。
私はコーヒーをいただきました。
正直、カフェが多い立地であれば、あえてココを選ぶというほどではないと思いますし、周辺のお店がまだ開店前だったので、ココしか開いてなかったからなのですが、入ってみると上品な店内で好感が持てました。
スタッフさんの対応もなかなか良く、コーヒーも美味しかったですよ。
